concise_definition: v. 滑倒, 滑动, 溜走, 误说; n. 滑倒, 纸条, 失误

definitions.explanation_en: To move smoothly and unintentionally along a surface, often due to lack of friction or loss of control.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因摩擦力不足或失去控制而沿着表面不自觉地滑动或滑行。
definitions.example_en: She slipped on the icy sidewalk and fell.
definitions.example_cn: 她在结冰的人行道上滑倒了。

definitions.explanation_en: To move quietly or stealthily, often to escape notice or avoid being caught.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指悄悄地、偷偷地移动，通常是为了不被注意或避免被抓住。
definitions.example_en: He slipped out of the room while no one was looking.
definitions.example_cn: 趁没人注意，他悄悄溜出了房间。

definitions.explanation_en: To make an unintentional mistake, especially in speech or writing, such as saying the wrong word or omitting something important.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指无意中犯错，尤指说话或写作时说错词或遗漏重要内容。
definitions.example_en: I slipped and called my boss by the wrong name.
definitions.example_cn: 我不小心把老板的名字叫错了。

definitions.explanation_en: A small piece of paper used for writing a brief message, note, or record, often temporary or informal.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用于书写简短信息、便条或记录的一小张纸，通常为临时或非正式用途。
definitions.example_en: She left a slip of paper with her phone number on the kitchen counter.
definitions.example_cn: 她在厨房台面上留下了一张写有电话号码的纸条。

definitions.explanation_en: A minor mistake or error, especially one that is embarrassing or reveals a lapse in judgment or attention.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指轻微的错误或过失，尤指令人尴尬或暴露判断或注意力疏忽的失误。
definitions.example_en: It was just a slip of the tongue—he didn’t mean to offend anyone.
definitions.example_cn: 这不过是口误而已——他并非有意冒犯任何人。

comparison.analysis: “Slide” (滑动) 强调沿表面平稳、持续的移动，常用于物理动作，如滑梯、冰面滑行，通常不带有隐含的“无意”或“逃避”意味。而 “slip” 更强调失去控制、意外或偷偷摸摸的性质，常含负面或隐蔽的语义色彩。
“Mistake” (错误) 是一个更广泛、更正式的词，泛指任何错误的判断、行为或决定。而 “slip” 作为名词时特指轻微、偶然、非故意的失误，如口误或笔误，语气更轻，常用于日常语境。
“Escape” (逃脱) 指主动、有意识地逃离危险、限制或责任，通常带有强烈的意图和紧迫感。而 “slip” 在表示“溜走”时，强调的是悄无声息、不引人注意的离开，动作更轻巧、隐蔽，不一定涉及危险或压力。
